title: Ticket #4300: Job left queue after failed file transfer w/ MAX_TRANSFER_QUEUE_AGE
description:
Customer reports the following problem:

I had a file transfer failure (download) due to the transfer exceeding the MAX_TRANSFER_QUEUE_AGE. That is not the problem. I like that feature. The problem is that condor treated the job like it had succeeded. This was particularly problematic because the job was part of a much larger DAG job. Dagman assumed the job completed successfully and submitted all of its children. The children in turn failed because they depend on the output file of the parent job as an input file.

I can see how someone might want it both ways (fail or not based on a failed file transfer). Would it be possible to add a flag to the submit file stating that if the file transfer fails the job should be treated as incomplete and run again?
